title: Credit Suisse Sees 'Guarded Optimism' in Markets
text: Apr.07 -- John Woods, chief investment officer of Asia-Pacific at Credit Suisse, discusses investor sentiment, market volatility amid the coronavirus outbreak, and the opportunities he sees.

title: Asian shares turn cautious, oil rebounds in choppy trade
text: Asian stocks stepped back on Wednesday after two sessions of sharp gains as investors tempered their optimism about the coronavirus while death tolls were still mounting across the globe.

title: U.S. stock futures seek direction in volatile session
text: U.S. stock index futures swung up and down, searching for direction late Tuesday, following another volatile day on Wall Street.

title: Silicon Valley Bank only started processing stimulus loan applications today
text: In a sign of just how broken the process is for startups looking to receive stimulus dollars, Silicon Valley Bank, the bank that claims “more innovative startups bank with us than any other bank,” only just began processing claims today. “Since the CARES Act and the PPP were announced, we have been hard at work […]

title: Jim Cramer says there is a key difference between the 'coronavirus recession' and Great Recession
text: "Even genuinely troubled companies can raise capital here, a good sign for the economy, at least for now," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Oil prices jump as focus swivels to OPEC, Russia meeting on output cuts
text: Oil climbed on Wednesday, reversing most of the prior session's losses, as investors pinned hopes on a Thursday meeting where OPEC members and allied producers will discuss output cuts to shore up prices that have tumbled amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Kudlow: 'We're looking to reopen economy, once health experts give 'green light'
text: White house advisor Larry Kudlow says he is waiting for a 'green light' from health experts to reopen the economy amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Navarro warned White House in January about pandemic risk: NYT
text: The New York Times reported White House trade advisor Peter Narvarro warned in a January memo that the coronavirus pandemic could threaten millions of Americans.

title: Asian shares poised to follow Wall Street's rocky lead
text: Asian stock futures were under pressure on Wednesday after a late, sharp sell-off on Wall Street and as oil prices slumped under pressure from swelling global supplies.

title: Coronavirus continues to impact markets and economy as stocks erase gains ending lower for session
text: Cole Smead, President and Portfolio Manager at Smead Capital Management discusses the impact the coronavirus has had on markets and why he optimistic about an economic recovery.

title: Dow gives up 900-point surge due to afternoon profit-taking: Pro
text: Boston Private Wealth's Shannon Saccocia and Steve Weiss, Short Hills Capital, discuss today's wild market swing and what it means for markets going forward.

title: US stock futures fall after markets finished down Tuesday
text: US stock futures were down after-hours Tuesday, following a day when US stocks lost steam into the close and finished lower after a hot start to the trading day.

title: Jim Cramer: The VIX shows 'big fear' is out of the market, but stocks aren't 'ready to roar'
text: "[T]here's no need to chase stocks after this week's rally. You can afford to be patient and buy the dips," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Trump says $70 billion in coronavirus rescue loans authorized. But where's the cash?
text: Roughly $70 billion of a $350 billion pot of loans to cover the payrolls of ailing small businesses have been originated by U.S. lenders in recent days, President Donald Trump said on Tuesday, adding that that money was "essentially loaned.

title: Secretary Mnuchin to meet with airlines to negotiate funds allocated from stimulus
text: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Fox Business he will be meeting with airline advisors this week to discuss stimulus money allocated for the airline industry.

title: The Coronavirus Retail Casualties Are Already Piling Up: Pier 1, Modell’s, Kaufhof
text: Even as forecasts turn dire for the number of retailers that won’t come out of this crisis, we’re already seeing victims from this devastating pandemic

title: Jim Cramer: Investors can 'put some money to work' on the next pullback
text: "Without a V shaped recovery, you have to be skeptical of these big moves higher," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Jim Cramer predicts 'U' shape recovery, says economy 'will bounce back gradually'
text: "In a U-shaped recovery I'm expecting, the stock market will pull back again and that is when you can put some money to work," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Stock futures fall slightly after volatile session for markets
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average gave up a 900-point rally to end the day in the red on Tuesday.

title: Market Uptrend Continues: Here's 20 New Stocks For Your Watchlists
text: IBD’s top-performing stock lists have just been updated. See which stocks got added – and which got cut.

title: Wall Street volatility raises fears of another selloff
text: The evaporation of a rally on Wall Street in the closing minutes of Tuesday's session shows that many investors fear the U.S. stock market is in danger of a renewed tumble due to uncertainty surrounding  the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The rally is running out of steam, and for good reason
text: The stock market gave up massive gains on Tuesday, and stocks have gone from dramatically oversold to no longer oversold, at least on a short-term level.

title: Phil Camporeale on what's next for the markets
text: Phil Camporeale gives his perspective on what could be next for the markets.

title: Today's big market reversal
text: The traders weigh in on today's 800-point market swing. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

title: Lee Munson talks coronavirus, recession and the stock market lows
text: Lee Munson, Portfolio Wealth Advisors President & CIO, spoke with Yahoo Finance's Jen Rogers about the stock market amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Energy stocks should bounce back nicely: Equities pro
text: CNBC's Kelly Evans talks with Barry Bannister of Stifel about the outlook for markets amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Seeking $250 billion more for payment protection program: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin
text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports on Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin's tweet indicating that Congress is working to secure an additional $250 billion for the small business that need the money.

title: Problems with PPP as banks, businesses hit by rocky rollout
text: CNBC's Kate Rogers reports on concerns small businesses have regarding the Small Business Administration's loan program.

title: Could be up to 25 million jobless claims over coronavirus: JPM economist
text: CNBC's "The Exchange" breaks down the future of the U.S. economy and current unemployment numbers amid the coronavirus pandemic with Jesse Edgerton of J.P. Morgan.

title: We're still just starting a recession: Investing pro
text: CNBC's "The Exchange" breaks down markets with Richard Weiss of American Century Investments and Scott Wren of Wells Fargo.

title: Kudlow staying 'as optimistic as possible' about the second half of economy
text: National Economic Council Director Larry Kudlow says he's optimistic about the economy bouncing back in the second half of 2020 despite the coronavirus crisis.

title: Market Visibility For The Always Responders
text: On today's Coronavirus Freight Market Update, Michael Vincent and Kevin Hill will be talking about the economic impact that covid-19 is having on freight and the transportation industry.

title: European and Asian Markets Green on Tuesday
text: U.S. stocks were in the red on Tuesday, a volatile day in which the Dow Jones Industrial Average was up more than 900 points during the morning, but closed in negative territory.

title: Tech shares close down on the day despite roaring start
text: American equities closed down today, with the major domestic indices all losing ground after a wild trading cycle.

title: As Fed Eyes Corporate Bond ETFs, Stocks Could Be Next Step
text: While the Federal Reserve may not be in a position to buy equities to support the markets, policymakers could begin to look at stock ETFs in the future. “It would be a substantial change to give the Federal Reserve the ability to buy stock,” Former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen told CNBC.

title: Markets End Their Panic But Remain Highly Tentative
text: With apologies to Winston Churchill, this is not the end or the beginning of the end, but it is the end of the beginning.

title: 'There's no playbook for people' says State Street CEO on the markets
text: State Street Chairman and CEO Ronald O'Hanley joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: U.S. Treasury liquidity on the mend, but without Fed remains fragile
text: Some measures of liquidity in the $17 trillion U.S. Treasury market are almost back to normal, thanks to the Federal Reserve's giant purchases, after drying up two weeks ago at the height of the coronavirus panic, but trading conditions remain challenging.

title: Major US Indexes Close Slightly Lower Tuesday (April 07)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 22,653.86 on Tuesday with a loss of 26.13 points or -0.12%.

title: Dow Jones Today: Bullish Possibilities on Hopes Coronavirus Is Peaking
text: Over the past two days, leadership is being sourced from the names most severely punished in the coronavirus downturn, including airlines, casino and cruise line operators and hoteliers. The read-in is that investors are willing to wager that when the coronavirus issue subsides, there will be pent up demand to get out of the house and get back to enjoying life.

title: As stocks give up gains, Cramer and others weigh in on the state of the market
text: Stocks gave up gains late Tuesday. Three market experts say equities are not yet in the all-clear.

title: Stock Market Today: Another Chinese Short Report; Sell GM?
text: Muddy Waters, the one who nailed Luckin Coffee, has a new short report out on a different company. Here's the stock market today.

title: Bond market reflecting fundamentals: Jeff Rosenberg
text: Jeffrey Rosenberg, BlackRock senior portfolio manager, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets and bonds.

title: Wall Street ends lower after volatile session
text: Wall Street fell on Tuesday after a volatile session and following tentative early signs that coronavirus outbreaks in some of the biggest U.S. hot spots may be plateauing.

title: Stocks appear at the end of a bear market, says Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson
text: Mike Wilson, Chief U.S. Equity Strategist at Morgan Stanley joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Tuesday (April 07)
text: Stocks were rising on hopes the number of new virus cases may be abating, but the rally lost steam late in the day.

title: Dow stages a nearly 1,000-point U-turn Tuesday to end barely lower in choppy, coronavirus-tinged trade
text: U.S. stocks finished a volatile session in negative territory, as investors failed to nudge equity benchmarks to a second straight gain.

title: Stocks Turn Negative As Experts Warn Against Undue Coronavirus Optimism
text: The market rose nearly 4%, before ending the day negative.

title: Cowen's Solomon Says the Most Violent Market Moves Have Already Been Seen
text: Cowen Inc. Chief Executive Officer Jeffrey Solomon says the most severe moves in equities are behind investors and M&A fears may clear up over the next quarter. He speaks with Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu and Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."
